channel.title: An embarrasing question:
channel.description:
Hey guys. I know this is probably THE MOST nooby question ever about java, but keep in mind that I only started learning a few days ago. Please do not make fun of me for this because at least I'm doing something productive and will be able to eventually contribute to the java-sided community here.. Ready for it? Well anyways, I've been reading a very large java tut. All this time it's been making me type this in:
public static void main(String args[]) {
Every single one of the programs seems to need that so far. Well anyways, basically I wanted to take my knowledge to the test and try to break down other people's code to see if i could understand what is going on and how things work. There is one common thing I noticed. Everyone seems to have the "[]" in a different place. Everyone here does this:
public static void main(String[b][][/b] args) {
My question is basically why? What is the difference, if any? Should I be making a habbit to put thr "[]" in that spot? This is basically all out of my curiosity. Thanks

item.title: An embarrasing question:
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

yea, the java compiler doesnt care about whitespace, which depending on how you look at it, is good or bad. it leaves java open for a great variety of styling

Read full topic

item.title: An embarrasing question:
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

To my surprise, it seems that javac will even accept whitespace and/or comments in the brackets:

String[ /* LEIK WTF TIHS COMPILEZ */] arguments

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Kryptizzler Kryptizzler
item.description:
@Kryptizzler wrote:

Everyone has their own way of learning.

@Pwnd wrote:

Yeah, that basically signifies the declaration of an array.

item.description:

Doesn’t the [] make it an array? Or am I just stupid?

item.title: An embarrasing question:
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

Also, public static void main(String[] args) {, args doesn’t have to be named args. e.g., public static void main(String[] dipshit)

Read full topic

item.title: An embarrasing question:
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

in java it doesnt matter where you put it, though it is much better to put it after the type

type[] identifier; // because it is an array of type, not an array of identifier

Read full topic

item.description:
@jme wrote:

Hey guys. I know this is probably THE MOST nooby question ever about java, but keep in mind that I only started learning a few days ago. Please do not make fun of me for this because at least I’m doing something productive and will be able to eventually contribute to the java-sided community here…

Ready for it? Well anyways, I’ve been reading a very large java tut. All this time it’s been making me type this in:

Every single one of the programs seems to need that so far. Well anyways, basically I wanted to take my knowledge to the test and try to break down other people's code to see if i could understand what is going on and how things work. There is one common thing I noticed. Everyone seems to have the "[]" in a different place. Everyone here does this:

My question is basically why? What is the difference, if any? Should I be making a habbit to put thr "[]" in that spot? This is basically all out of my curiosity.
